title: The boards: "Riot doesn't let us innovate or do creative stuff"
body: Also the boards: **"Any time anything goes anywhere outside of where it's always gone for the past half-decade, the balance team needs to be skewered in the kidney on Instagram Live for it."**

It's an interesting psychological paradigm here, but the fear of being 'in the minority' leads to people trending towards staying completely out of discussions rather than stepping into them and being ganged up on by the people agreeing with it. As a result, once a thread starts to get popular, dissenting voices stay away OR start their own thread in the hopes they can get people who agree to 'hivemind' with them.

This leads to threads not often having a lot of dissenting discussion and a lot of hive-mind threads.

Wrongo. We advocate against *unbalanced* role displacement.

For instance, Viktor top was absolutely dumb. Countered a vast majority of top laners. He needed nerfs to this build, as many said, not removal.

More examples of just top lane: Tank Ekko top, Lulu top, Tank Kassadin top, Rek'Sai pre-rework top, Ryze pre-rework top. All of these we were fine with being top, but were all grossly over-tuned at some point on top of having kits that beat out a majority of the residents, thus the hate.

The reason is that by riot taking such hard control over the balance of the game, they created massive disparities between the optimal and inefficient, so now the only "innovation" that does occur is sparse and dramatically powerful. 

The disparity between playing a champion in a position, with a rune set, and with a build, that are both tailored around each other, and a champion maybe in the same position, with a different rune page, and a different build, just ends up having exponential power drop off the further you move away from the optimum.

So the only "innovation", which happens now would probably be better described as a balance "oversight".

If they didn't want to be screwed either way, then their best option would be to lower the power gaps by reducing the efficiency of the most optimal builds. Less significantly punish players, but also to prevent excessively strong new builds from popping up.
